comment: Professor Jones is a very nice person and I truly believe that he thinks he is doing a good job. However his quizzes and tests have insanely specific questions that are sometimes not even in his lectures or textbooks. The weekly readings are around 100 pages each and uses minute details as questions. Do NOT take this class it will mess up your GPA.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: dr. jones is a great professor. he uses lockdown browser but as long as you read the required readings per week, you should breeze through although it gets repetitive. he gives great feedback and actually tries to get to know his students. loved this course!!!!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Well firstly, just do not take this man. I'm in Calculus 2 and Physics 1, not to mention the other two classes I'm in. But for reference, this is my hardest course so far. He wants us to read 40-page chapters every week with a lockdown browser + webcam quiz every week. 3 Tests, and some papers. He takes this class way too seriously.

Weekly reading quizzes which go of the textbook, and use Lockdown browser with webcam monitoring. Class is overwhelming and seems overly serious. Its stated that you should expect to spend multiple hours a week focusing on this class. In my opinion this is too much work for a general ED class, especially if taking STEM related classes alongside.

This man uses Lockdown Browser likes it's his best friend. His teaching strategy is far too strenuous especially for this being a gen ed history class. You will have a very hard time in this class unless you are a history major.

Dr. Jones is definitely knowledgeable in this field, but he believes the best strategy for teaching is having us read 40-50 pages/week while taking extremely detailed/ specific notes. If you are a good reader/ note taker, this is great class for you. I got 100/95's on every assignment but struggled on the 2/3 tests so I missed the A honor roll...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tough grader--Gives good feedback

comment: READ YOUR TEXTBOOK. His test are based off the test book and thankfully his lectures go hand and hand with the book. Make sure you read whatever required reading before class so you can ask questions later. Test are fairly easy as long as you know your information. He doesnt allow electronics though so I recommend recording the lectures.

Take Dr. Jones! Although I'm a history major I'm not a big fan of U.S History. But, he makes it fun, enjoyable and easy to understand. You will have to do some studying in this class to pass it but, as long as you do so you'll be fine. He also gives extra credit!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I would 10/10 recommend him for US HIST since 1877. His lectures are very engaging and he makes sure you understand the info. He responds to emails in a very timely manner as well. You will need a text book and you will read the majority of it with quizzes. If you go to lecture and read the text book you will pass 100%.

I studied harder for this class than I have any other and only made a C. Dr. Jones is a great guy but his class just felt so unnecessarily hard. 5 question weekly reading quizzes, weekly discussions, 4 primary source analysis papers (was 6 before), and 3 tests. Very textbook and lecture oriented class. If you don't like history, you will fail.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I'm not sure if it was just because this class was online but I had the hardest time ever in this class. There were weekly 5 question reading quizzes which I mostly got 40s or 60s on. There were 4 primary source analysis papers which were very easy to do completely wrong and you're not allowed to use any other source besides the textbook or lecture

I joined the class a couple days into drop/add but because it was organized so well, I was able to get caught up very easily. There were weekly reading quizzes, bi-weekly discussion posts, 4 primary source analysis papers, and 3 exams. He gave amazing feedback to help you succeed and answers emails within at most an hour. PLEASE TAKE DR. JONES!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Weekly reading quizzes and a biweekly podcast discussion board. There were a lot of primary source analysis papers at first but it got cut down to only needing to do 4. There were 3 units with tests and the last one was the final. The 1st 2 tests were alright but he got really mad at people trying to cheat that he made the final really difficult :(
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Do not take this class. Maybe it was because it was online, but it was the most difficult history class I've ever taken. Never seen anyone so specific was the context of terms along with the dates you need to remember. For not being a major class, this class was way harder than it needed to be. 4.5 is too high. Recommend you find another teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: He is an excellent professor. He cares about his students. Class does acquire a lot of reading. You will have a quiz each week over the chapter you have read over. Then three big exams. You will also have a paper due every other week called a primary analysis source paper. Overall, this class has a heavy workload, but it is hard to fail.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: One of the best professors I have ever had. If you do the work and listen to his feedback you will get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He's one of the best History teachers I've had and he definitely cares for his students. He's passionate and his lectures are always very interesting and entertaining. Sometimes he might talk a little fast for note taking so be wary. Makes you work for your grade through lots of reading, but he's an absolutely great teacher, would take again.

Not the easiest class but I think it's worth taking his class. He's always nice and respectful to everyone. He gives chapter quiz every Friday so make sure you read and get ready. Also, he cares attendings too so make sure to go to class.

Dr. Jones is very professional and his lectures are filled with content. He clearly knows what he is talking about and is passionate about history. He cares about his students and answers emails very quickly if you catch him at the right time. Textbooks are required and there is a lot of reading. Tests are difficult if you don't study. Take Jones!

Dr. Jones is very kind and understanding. The class can be hard. There are 3 tests, the final being the third test (non-cumulative). There is a reading quiz every week to make sure that you've read the corresponding chapter. Also, there's a discussion every friday. There is also this useless history book report that I think he should have removed.

He's amazing! The class is not super easy, but very worth it. It is all lecturing, so be prepared to write. You also have to read the textbook to do well on weekly quizzes. There is one book report, but if you don't procrastinate, it's easy. He made history fun and interesting. You are guaranteed to learn in this class. I would recommend to all.

Dr. Andrew Jones is a really caring history professor! His tests are really hard, be aware! He gives you a good amount to study for the tests by basing it off of a small study guide, but you have to define the terms very in-depth, which is difficult. No phones/computers in class so be aware. Hard 5 Q quiz every week. He provides up to 10% in EC!

3 tests, 1 paper, extra credit galore. TAKE HIM. I had struggles inside and outside of class and went to him and he cares so so much. With COVID-19, he really gave us so much opportunity to do well and was very gracious. I wish I could take him again, and will definitely be going to him when I take world history next semester.

An amazing prof. Truly cares and makes class fun, if you need help he'll be there for you. Reading quiz every week, 3 tests, and a book report are what make up your grade. Once a week there are fun discussions centered around a primary source. He is wonderful! TAKE HIS CLASS!!!

He was great! We had a reading quiz every Friday along with a discussion with groups he made. There were only 3 tests including the final so make sure you study! Overall though, he really cares about his students and is really funny and chill. He doesn't like phones but as long as you pay attention in class you'll be fine. And get the textbook!!
A professor who truly cares about his students.

Quiz every week, 3 hard tests, but so much opportunity for extra credit. Go to class and it may save your grade if you work hard but still struggle. Read and review key terms. He is so funny and super caring.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Jones is a very good teacher who gives interesting lectures and cares about the success of his students. During the coronavirus situation, he was understanding of the effect it had on students and provided easy bonus points online. If you just read the book and listen to the lectures, you'll do good.

okay.. so great teacher. BUT he has lecture slides of the topic he will talk about. I like to take notes off powerpoints, its just how i learn. He talks fast so AUDIO RECORD HIM!!!! and go back and take notes off the audio. You have to read 40/50 pages out of the textbook A WEEK for a 5 question quiz every friday. HARD CLASS. 10/10 will cry........
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Jones was amazing! I truly wish I could take him again for a different history class. He makes the class extremely enjoyable by being energetic and passionate about what he is teaching. I would recommend anyone to take him for history, because he is a great guy and professor who cares about his students success.

I actually enjoyed Prof. Jones a lot. Would 100% take again if he were teaching other history classes. He makes the class an enjoyable environment and takes feedback from the students. There were 4 exams but he gives out a study guide for each of them. There's barely no homework and he offers extra credit opportunities too. Great professor
